Patch Set 6: Commit message was updated.
Change has been successfully merged by Josh Wilsdon

I think it might make more sense to change the order here? This way the code at 2180 would match the code at 2176. In either case, I think we should add a comment that explains what the data is expected to look like. Another option that might make this less confusing to look at would be to swap the order in the hosts at 2057 so that the two arrays are in the same order.

I like the suggestion to change the order at the point of extraction (line 2150) so that both 'hosts' and 'extraHosts' have the _same_ order and that both are ordered to match the order of the values in /etc/hosts itself.

Since 'hosts' is defined in the intuitive order (which matches the order in the hosts file), it seems appropriate to comment the change on 2150.
haven't had a chance to fully look, but that "hosts" and "extraHosts" would have reversed order after this change feels subtle, perhaps wrong.
